resources.string:
Artwork - Adventuresmith

Application launch icon, splash screen logo, and nav-drawer-header logo were created by Brian Todd Christensen.

Licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License, available at http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0

Based on work at https://stevesea.github.io/Adventuresmith/
Permissions beyond the scope of this license may be available at http://briantchristensen.com/Adventuresmith

Artwork - Icons

This application uses icons from https://materialdesignicons.com/

This application uses icons from http://ionicons.com/

Artwork - Public Domain

Apocalypse, Flanders 15th century (BnF, Néerlandais 3, fol. 7r)

Hans Vintler, Die Pluemen der Tugent, Vienna 1450 (Wien, Österreichische Nationalbibliothek, cod. s. n. 12819, fol. 129r)

Guillaume de Digulleville, Pèlerinage de vie humaine, France 14th century (Aix-en-Provence, Bibliothèque municipale, ms. 110, p. 127)

Lancelot du Lac, Hainaut 1344 (BnF, Français 122, fol. 1r)

Lambert of Saint-Omer, Liber Floridus, France ca. 1250-1275 (BnF, Latin 8865, fol. 36v)

Speculum humanae salvationis (`Krumlovský sborník`), Bohemia ca. 1420 (Praha, Knihovna Národního muzea, III B 10, fol. 47r)

Saint Augustine, `La Cité de Dieu` (French translation of `De Civitate Dei`), France ca. 1450 (Strasbourg, Bibliothèque nationale et universitaire, ms. 523, fol. 39v)

medical miscellany (`Wellcome Apocalypse`), Germany 1420 (London, Wellcome Library, MS.49, fol. 35r)

book of hours, Provence ca. 1485-1490 (Moulins, Bibliothèque municipale, ms. 89, fol. 88r)

bestiary, England 13th century (British Library, Harley 4751, fol. 58v)

Giovanni Boccaccio, De casibus virorum illustrium (French translation), Bruges ca. 1479-1480 (BL, Royal 14 E V, fol. 439v)

Apocalypse, Belgium ca. 1313 (BnF, Français 13096, fol. 86v)

Vincent of Beauvais, Le Mirouer historial (French translation of Speculum historiale), Paris 1463 (BnF, Français 50, fol. 14r)

BnF, Français 308, fol. 13r

Apocalypse, Belgium ca. 1313 (BnF, Français 13096, fol. 36r)

Convenevole da Prato, Carmina regia, Tuscany ca. 1335 (BL, Royal 6 E IX, fol. 6v)

Psalter and hours (`Prayerbook of Alphonso V of Aragon`), Valencia ca. 1436-1443 (BL, Additional 28962, fol. 136v)

book of hours, Ghent 15th century (Baltimore, The Walters Art Museum, Walters Manuscript W.170, fol. 157v)

Hours of Catherine of Cleves, Netherlands ca. 1440 (NY, Morgan Library and Museum, MS M.945, fol. 168v)

Institutes of Justinian, France 15th century (Montpellier, Bibliothèque interuniversitaire. Section Médecine, H 418, fol. 107v)

pontifical, Paris 13th century (Besançon, Bibliothèque municipale, ms. 138, fol. 50r)

Beatus of Liébana, Commentaria in Apocalypsin (the `Beatus of Saint-Sever`), Saint-Sever before 1072 (BnF, Latin 8878, fol. 184v)

Pierre de Saint-Nectaire, Orationes, France ca. 1510 (Clermont-Ferrand, Bibliothèque municipale, ms. 1510, fol. 13r)

Apocalypse, Normandy ca. 1330 (BnF, Latin 14410, p. 79)

Le Livre et le vraye hystoire du bon roy Alixandre, France 1420 (British Library, Royal 20 B XX, fol. 83v)

Jacobus de Voragine, La Légende Dorée (Legenda aurea), France 1470 (BL, Yates Thompson 49 vol. 1, fol. 34v)

Stammheim Missal, Hildesheim ca. 1170 (LA, Getty Museum, Ms. 64, fol. 117r)

`Roman d`Alexandre en prose` (`Talbot Shrewsbury book`), Rouen 1444-1445 (British Library, Royal 15 E VI, fol. 20v)

Froissart`s Chronicles, Bruges ca. 1470-1475 (Paris, BnF, Français 2643, fol. 72r)

Jacobus de Teramo, `Litigatio Christi cum Belial` (German translation of `Consolatio peccatorum, seu Processus Luciferi contra Jesum Christum`), Germany 1461 (München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 48, fol. 132r)

Ottheinrich Bible, Regensburg ca. 1430, illuminations by Matthias Gerung 1530-1531 (München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 8010, fol. 295r)

`The Ashmole Bestiary`, England 13th century (Bodleian Library, MS. Ashmole 1511, fol. 15v)

Pugna virtutum et vitiorum, Bavaria 14th century (Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 3003, fol. 53v)

Diebold Schilling the Elder, Spiezer Chronik, Bern 1484-85 (Bern, Burgerbibliothek, Mss.h.h.I.16, p. 227)

Beatus of Liébana, Commentaria in Apocalypsin (the ‘Beatus of Saint-Sever’), Saint-Sever before 1072 (BnF, Latin 8878, fol. 13r)

Pontifical of Renaud de Bar, France ca. 1303-1316 (Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum, MS 298, fol. 41r)

book of hours, Italy ca. 1480 (BL, Yates Thompson 7, fol. 174r)

bestiary, England ca. 1200 (Aberdeen University Library, MS 24, fol. 12r)

Thanks!

Many people helped during development — testing, ideas, encouragement, etc. An incomplete list includes

Brian Christensen, Liz Christensen, Camilla Nash, Kate Moir, Jason Lutes, Eric Nieudan, Matthieu B, Luka Rejec, Joe Banner, Jeremy Strandberg, Aaron Griffin, Ben Milton, and others!


James D`Amato, Kat Kuhl, and others at http://oneshotpodcast.com/ — thank you for re-invigorating my love of RPGs!

Adventuresmith

Version: %1$s (%2$d)

Adventuresmith is written and maintained by Steve Christensen.

Adventuresmith is an open source application, licensed under GPL v3.0 https://opensource.org/licenses/GPL-3.0

If you are interested in creating generators, adding translations, or want to run Adventuresmith on the desktop, check out the wiki:

https://github.com/stevesea/Adventuresmith/wiki

To request enhancements or report problems, please visit

https://stevesea.github.io/Adventuresmith/

Thirdparty software libraries

Adventuresmith makes use of the following software libraries

Jackson https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson

JMustache https://github.com/samskivert/jmustache

CakeParse https://github.com/sargunster/cakeparse

MaterialDrawer https://github.com/mikepenz/MaterialDrawer

FastAdapter https://github.com/mikepenz/fastadapter

Android-Iconics https://github.com/mikepenz/Android-Iconics

Crashlytics/Answers - https://fabric.io

LeakCanary https://github.com/square/leakcanary
